Espadrilles, alpargatas or espardenyes are normally casual, flat, but sometimes 
high-heeled shoes originated in the Pyrenees. They usually have a canvas or 
cotton fabric upper and a flexible sole made of jute rope. The jute rope sole is the 
defining characteristic of an espadrille; the uppers ... Its name in the Basque 
region is espartina.
